title: Towards automated detection of basal cell carcinoma from polarization sensitive optical coherence tomography images of human skin
abstract: We report on the initial results of the first automated classifier to distinguish basal cell carcinomas and healthy skin using polarization sensitive optical coherence tomography (PS-OCT) with a sensitivity and specificity of 84.2% and 85.8%.

tldr.text: The first automated classifier to distinguish basal cell carcinomas and healthy skin using polarization sensitive optical coherence tomography (PS-OCT) with a sensitivity and specificity of 84.2% and 85.8% is reported on.

references.title: Automated identification of basal cell carcinoma by polarization-sensitive optical coherence tomography.
